metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: 米トランプ政権 自動車排ガス規制撤廃を発表
all.description: アメリカのトランプ政権は、2009年に当時のオバマ政権が行った、温室効果ガスが公衆の健康と福祉の脅威だとする政府の決定を取り消し、自動車による温室効果ガスの排出規制を撤廃すると発表しました。気候変動を最優先課題の1つに掲げたバイデン前政権からの大きな政策転換で、気候変動に取り組む国際社会からの反発も強まりそうです。

all.headline: スノーボード女子ハーフパイプ 小野光希が銅メダル【全結果】
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピックのスノーボード女子ハーフパイプで、21歳の小野光希選手が85.00をマークして、銅メダルを獲得しました。決勝のすべての結果、試合の経過をお伝えしています。

all.headline: スキー男子モーグル 堀島行真が銅メダル 2大会連続 五輪
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スキーフリースタイル男子モーグルで、堀島行真選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。堀島選手は2大会連続の銅メダル獲得です。

all.headline: 田久保前伊東市長側 卒業証書とされる書類の警察への提出拒否
all.description: 学歴詐称の疑いが指摘され、公職選挙法違反などの疑いで刑事告発されている静岡県伊東市の田久保真紀前市長側が、警察に対し、卒業証書とされる書類の提出を拒否したことが関係者への取材でわかりました。

all.headline: 日米合意に基づく80兆円規模の投資巡り閣僚間で協議
all.description: 日米合意に基づく5500億ドル、日本円にして80兆円規模のアメリカへの投資をめぐり、赤澤経済産業大臣はラトニック商務長官と会談しました。第1弾となるプロジェクトの選定で詰めの協議を行ったとみられます。

all.headline: 中道 代表選挙 階氏と小川氏が立候補 きょう投票 新代表選出へ
all.description: 衆議院選挙で大敗した中道改革連合の代表選挙は13日午後投票が行われ、新たな代表が選出されます。

all.headline: 全国的に気温上昇 雪どけ進むおそれ 雪崩や落雪などに注意
all.description: 13日は東日本と西日本を中心に晴れ、全国的に最高気温は平年よりも高くなると予想されています。15日日曜日にかけて気温はさらに上がる見込みで、積雪が多い地域では雪崩や屋根からの落雪などに引き続き、注意してください。

all.headline: South Korea's Choi dethrones halfpipe star Kim as Ono takes bronze
all.description: Choi bounced back from a brutal fall in her first run to triumph over the two-time defending Olympic champion.

all.headline: Almost 80% in Japan feel public safety worsened over past decade: survey
all.description: As reasons for the deterioration, many respondents cited increases in the number of fraud cases and personal data breaches resulting from unauthorized access.

all.headline: Struggling Nissan forecasts $4.2 billion full-year net loss
all.description: The company sharply lowered the forecast for its annual operating loss to ¥60 billion, citing the acceleration of its restructuring measures.

all.headline: Dai-ichi Life reports 1,155 unauthorized data transfers
all.description: The information taken from the insurance agents without permission included personal data of customers, Dai-ichi Life Holdings said.

all.headline: Ukraine skeleton racer Heraskevych disqualified from Olympics over memorial helmet
all.description: The IOC said he had been kicked out of the Milano Cortina Games "after refusing to adhere to the IOC athlete expression guidelines."

all.headline: 336 online posts hinting attacks found during Lower House race
all.description: Police discovered the posts through internet monitoring conducted as part of their efforts to prevent attacks by lone offenders.

all.headline: Australian Woods edges Kingsbury and Horishima in epic men's moguls final
all.description: Horishima was forced to settle for bronze for the second straight Olympics.

all.headline: Japan eyes development of national intelligence strategy
all.description: If compiled, it would be the first Japanese national strategy dedicated to intelligence.

all.headline: Fewer women and girls to give Valentine's Day gifts amid high chocolate prices
all.description: The high price of cocoa beans, the basic ingredient for chocolate, have made many choose lower-priced items and reduce the number of gifts they purchase, a recent survey shows.

all.headline: SoftBank swings to profit on valuation boost from OpenAI bet
all.description: As of December, SoftBank’s investment gain on OpenAI stood at an estimated $19.8 billion.

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Mitsuki Ono Wins Bronze in Women’s Snowboard Halfpipe; Japan’s Medal Count Reaches 10
all.description: The Yomiuri ShimbunMitsuki Ono poses for a photo with the bronze medal in her hand at the Milano Cortina Winter Games on Thursday. The Yomiuri Shimbun [posttime] JST, [postdate] Mitsuki Ono won

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Ikuma Horhisma Wins Bronze Medal in Men’s Freestyle Skiing Moguls, Second Consecutive Games Medal
all.description: Ikuma Horishima, 28, won the bronze medal, in the men’s freestyle skiing moguls Thursday at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics, following his medal from the previous Beijing Games.

all.headline: Japanese NBA Dancer-Turned-DJ to Perform at All-Star, Hopes to Boost League’s Popularity in Japan
all.description: When Chika Takai was lying on her sickbed and staring at the ceiling of her room in Saitama Prefecture over a decade ago, she never imagined what she’ll be experiencing this weekend — DJing at a packe

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: From Despair to Pure Joy: Takanashi’s 4-Year Journey in Ski Jumping
all.description: Four years ago, Sara Takanashi had been crying in despair at the Beijing Games, but now, she shed tears of joy as she contributed to Japan’s first bronze medal in the ski jumping mixed team event at t

all.headline: Flu Cases Surging Again: Infection Can Also Be Prevented by Humidifying Indoor Spaces
all.description: The number of flu patients has spiked again, reaching an alert level for the second time since November.

Polls close in first election since Gen Z protests ousted Bangladesh leader
all.description: Voters are hoping for a return to democracy after 15 years of authoritarian rule under Sheikh Hasina.

all.headline: Kim Jong Un chooses teen daughter as heir, says Seoul
all.description: South Korea's spy agency says Ki Ju Ae's prominent public presence indicates she is the chosen heir.

all.headline: China's Xi Jinping makes rare reference to recent military purge
all.description: Zhang Youxia, widely seen as Xi's closest military ally, was in January removed from his post.

all.headline: Principal shot in Thailand school siege dies of injuries
all.description: A gunman who laid siege to the school shot the principal and another female student who is out of danger.

all.headline: Three issues that matter to voters in the Bangladesh election
all.description: It's the first election since the 2024 Gen Z uprising that toppled Bangladesh's  long-serving prime minister Sheikh Hasina.

all.headline: Australia's first female Liberal leader faces leadership challenge
all.description: The shadow defence minister has resigned from the front bench and called for a leadership contest saying the party has "lost its way".

all.headline: India orders social media firms to remove unlawful content within three hours
all.description: Critics worry the rules would be a compliance challenge for tech platforms and could expand censorship.

all.headline: Emergency call released of boy who swam for hours to save family
all.description: Austin Appelbee, 13, swam to get help for his mother and siblings after they were swept out to sea.

all.headline: Indonesia preparing to deploy up to 8,000 soldiers to Gaza
all.description: It would be the first country to do so as part of phase two of the ceasefire agreement brokered by the US last year.

all.headline: Australian author's erotic novel is child sex abuse material, judge finds
all.description: The author's erotic novel featured an 18-year-old protagonist who role-played as a toddler.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

competitors.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

competitors.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
competitors.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

competitors.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
competitors.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

competitors.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
competitors.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

competitors.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
competitors.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

primary.headline: 米トランプ政権 自動車排ガス規制撤廃を発表
primary.description: アメリカのトランプ政権は、2009年に当時のオバマ政権が行った、温室効果ガスが公衆の健康と福祉の脅威だとする政府の決定を取り消し、自動車による温室効果ガスの排出規制を撤廃すると発表しました。気候変動を最優先課題の1つに掲げたバイデン前政権からの大きな政策転換で、気候変動に取り組む国際社会からの反発も強まりそうです。

primary.headline: スノーボード女子ハーフパイプ 小野光希が銅メダル【全結果】
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピックのスノーボード女子ハーフパイプで、21歳の小野光希選手が85.00をマークして、銅メダルを獲得しました。決勝のすべての結果、試合の経過をお伝えしています。

primary.headline: スキー男子モーグル 堀島行真が銅メダル 2大会連続 五輪
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スキーフリースタイル男子モーグルで、堀島行真選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。堀島選手は2大会連続の銅メダル獲得です。

primary.headline: 田久保前伊東市長側 卒業証書とされる書類の警察への提出拒否
primary.description: 学歴詐称の疑いが指摘され、公職選挙法違反などの疑いで刑事告発されている静岡県伊東市の田久保真紀前市長側が、警察に対し、卒業証書とされる書類の提出を拒否したことが関係者への取材でわかりました。

primary.headline: 日米合意に基づく80兆円規模の投資巡り閣僚間で協議
primary.description: 日米合意に基づく5500億ドル、日本円にして80兆円規模のアメリカへの投資をめぐり、赤澤経済産業大臣はラトニック商務長官と会談しました。第1弾となるプロジェクトの選定で詰めの協議を行ったとみられます。

primary.headline: 中道 代表選挙 階氏と小川氏が立候補 きょう投票 新代表選出へ
primary.description: 衆議院選挙で大敗した中道改革連合の代表選挙は13日午後投票が行われ、新たな代表が選出されます。

primary.headline: 全国的に気温上昇 雪どけ進むおそれ 雪崩や落雪などに注意
primary.description: 13日は東日本と西日本を中心に晴れ、全国的に最高気温は平年よりも高くなると予想されています。15日日曜日にかけて気温はさらに上がる見込みで、積雪が多い地域では雪崩や屋根からの落雪などに引き続き、注意してください。

primary.headline: South Korea's Choi dethrones halfpipe star Kim as Ono takes bronze
primary.description: Choi bounced back from a brutal fall in her first run to triumph over the two-time defending Olympic champion.

primary.headline: Almost 80% in Japan feel public safety worsened over past decade: survey
primary.description: As reasons for the deterioration, many respondents cited increases in the number of fraud cases and personal data breaches resulting from unauthorized access.

primary.headline: Struggling Nissan forecasts $4.2 billion full-year net loss
primary.description: The company sharply lowered the forecast for its annual operating loss to ¥60 billion, citing the acceleration of its restructuring measures.

primary.headline: Dai-ichi Life reports 1,155 unauthorized data transfers
primary.description: The information taken from the insurance agents without permission included personal data of customers, Dai-ichi Life Holdings said.

primary.headline: Ukraine skeleton racer Heraskevych disqualified from Olympics over memorial helmet
primary.description: The IOC said he had been kicked out of the Milano Cortina Games "after refusing to adhere to the IOC athlete expression guidelines."

primary.headline: 336 online posts hinting attacks found during Lower House race
primary.description: Police discovered the posts through internet monitoring conducted as part of their efforts to prevent attacks by lone offenders.

primary.headline: Australian Woods edges Kingsbury and Horishima in epic men's moguls final
primary.description: Horishima was forced to settle for bronze for the second straight Olympics.

primary.headline: Japan eyes development of national intelligence strategy
primary.description: If compiled, it would be the first Japanese national strategy dedicated to intelligence.

primary.headline: Fewer women and girls to give Valentine's Day gifts amid high chocolate prices
primary.description: The high price of cocoa beans, the basic ingredient for chocolate, have made many choose lower-priced items and reduce the number of gifts they purchase, a recent survey shows.

primary.headline: SoftBank swings to profit on valuation boost from OpenAI bet
primary.description: As of December, SoftBank’s investment gain on OpenAI stood at an estimated $19.8 billion.

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Ikuma Horhisma Wins Bronze Medal in Men’s Freestyle Skiing Moguls, Second Consecutive Games Medal
primary.description: Ikuma Horishima, 28, won the bronze medal, in the men’s freestyle skiing moguls Thursday at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics, following his medal from the previous Beijing Games.

primary.headline: Japanese NBA Dancer-Turned-DJ to Perform at All-Star, Hopes to Boost League’s Popularity in Japan

primary.headline: Study Finds Tyrannosaurus Rex Did Not Reach Full Size until Age 40

secondary.description: Zhang Youxia, widely seen as Xi's closest military ally, was in January removed from his post.

tweets:
I am deeply shocked and deeply saddened by the news of the shooting incident that occurred in British Columbia, Canada.
I would like to express my heartfelt condolences to the victims and offer my sincere condolences to their bereaved families, and sincerely pray for the speedy recovery of the injured.

I would like to express my sincere gratitude to Prime Minister Cristion for his message of congratulations.
Building on the strategic partnership between Japan and Sweden, I look forward to continuing to work with Prime Minister Kristässon to further strengthen Japan-Sweden relations.

Prime Minister Kristersson
@SwedishPM
 , I sincerely

Congratulations @takaichi_sanae on your win in Japan’s general election.

Sweden and Japan are close friends and strategic partners, and I look forward to continuing working with you for the benefit of both our countries.

I would like to express my sincere gratitude to Prime Minister Olupo for his message of congratulations.
Based on the strategic partnership between Japan and Finland, we would like to continue to further strengthen our relationship in various fields.

Prime Minister Orpo
@PetteriOrpo
, I sincerely appreciate your kind words of congratulations. Based on the

Congratulations to Prime Minister @takaichi_sanae on your historical election victory.
 
Finland and Japan are strategic partners. I look forward to continuing our strong cooperation.
